title: 'For me, climbing is safer than crossing the road': Meet the blind rock climber pushing the boundaries of what you can do without sight
text:
Stanage Edge, the Peak District, on a grey and windswept Sunday. Jesse Dufton is climbing ‘Flying Buttress Direct’, a classic climbing route on this gritstone crag. A delicate slab soon gives way to an intimidating overhanging roof. I’ve been here on sunny days and watched people give up on it.

A dog walker stops to watch. “Do you know who that is?” I ask. “Yeah, he’s amazing,” comes the reply. “I follow him on Instagram.”

We both stand pensively as Dufton makes his way up the face towards the overhang. Dufton looks relaxed, keeping his cool even when the rope gets tangled round his foot as he pulls himself up on to the tiny ledge above. If he fell now he’d plummet five metres with a swing....
description: Stanage Edge, the Peak District, on a grey and windswept Sunday.
